mn64:3.1: Given that Māluṅkyaputta got the answer right, it is not clear why the Buddha adopted such a reproving tone. Normally the Buddha responded in such a way in response to a dangerously mistaken view ([mn22:6.1]()). The commentary explains that he had the view that fetters were only present when active, hence the Buddha’s simile to follow. That may be so, but it is not in the text.
